Lochside Hotel Bowmore
reviews.text: Stayed here sharing a twin room with old school freind whan we came for a reunion. Room had small window but lovely view over loch. Natural light in bathroom too and we had a bath with shower over which was good.
Anyway, good points about this hotel:
reviews.title: Basic hotel, excellent experience, you'll not do better on Islay.

reviews.text: Very freindly and helpful staff - can't fault them. Good coffee for breakfast and very seemed relaxed about breakfast time. Lovely views from dining area.
reviews.title: A whisky experience

reviews.text: Room was clean and bed comfy. Biscuits with teamaking faciltiies in the room were replaced when necessary and the room was small but not too small. We each had an overbed light which worked, and a bedside table each.
reviews.title: Friendly

reviews.text: Sadly the Lochside has changed hands - all due respect, Bjorn E, but the lovely Duffie is no longer there and your review of your stay is a bit late! Now a non-resident owner and no real management has left the hard-working staff demoralised. This was a great wee hotel, not perfect but with a cheery atmosphere, good, in fact fast-improving, pub grub and great service. Now it's a shambles - if the new owners don't get a grip it will be ruined.
reviews.title: Going downhill

reviews.text: It seems that the staff here have given up. A regulor visitor to Islay, this place used to be a buzzing place with an excellent atmosphere and ambience. The food has always been a hit or a miss and recently has got a lot better.
reviews.title: Poor service, staff are slow and uninterested, food ok.

reviews.text: On a recent visit the staff it seemed were uninterested in our custom, I had to ask for menus, a drinks order and food order to be taken. My shock when the barman appeared with our drinks wearing tracksuit bottoms and trainers, really unprofessional. Most staff were friendly some just needed to smile. The menu was uninspiring with no thought whatsoever and written on a greasy piece of A4. Our food took around forty minutes to arrive and that was for each course, possible explanation, they had ran out of food......in the middle of service we did spot a young girl possibly a kitchen porter arriving back with bags of shopping from the local Co op. To be honest it all seemed a tad shambolic. In fairness the food that arrived was acceptable and relativley tasty.
reviews.title: Scottish hospitality at its best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's clear the lochside is lacking proper management who should be in place to correct these points I have picked up on, I'm sure there are likley to be plenty more too.
reviews.title: Wrong Price!!

reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are not big, the lobby isn't posh and you have to carry your luggage up the stairs. But the friendliness, the atmosphere, the location - and not to forget the one and only -Duffy's Bar. Have you never tasted Islay whiskeys? Ask Duffy where to start. Are you an expert in the taste of smoke and peat? Ask Duffy where to go further. Are you just looking for someone to share a joke? Ask Duffy or just wait for the next local to enter.
reviews.title: Peat-freak Viking from Sweden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a single (week) night in late May. The downstairs bar and conservatory looked very pleasant and were busy at night. The pub is set right on the shore front with a small and slightly shabby beer garden over looking the beach which was appreciated as the weather was lovely.
reviews.title: Nice location, lively bar but very poor value accomodation

reviews.text: Our room was very small and basic, but clean, and the hotel section of the pub is in serious need of a revamp - if they are going to justify the expensive rates. Sadly we had assumed the £130 a night would equate to very pleasant accommodation. However, it would appear this is simple a reflection of the prices that can be charged when accommodation options are limited. A hotel in any other beautiful, rural, location in Scotland - of which we have stayed in many - would be charging half of this per night. We didn't eat in at night, breakfast was OK.
reviews.title: Lovely views, friendly staff

reviews.text: Overall, good pub (probably)! Very poor accommodation. :(
reviews.title: Flying Visit
Group holiday
reviews.text: the hotel is very centrally located in Bowmore. We had a very nice twin room, overlooking the loch, and were able to enjoy lovely views from the windows. It is worth asking for a lochside view, as some rooms face over the street. Some rooms in the hotel are quite small, but our one was a very reasonable size. Staff are very friendly and helpful and quick to attend to any issues that arise. The restaurant has a beautiful outlook over the loch. Breakfasts are good and the one dinner we had was also good and reasonably priced. There is a lively bar, but noise was not a problem as our room was away from the bar area. Prices are a little high, but not out of line with costs of other accommodation in Bowmore.
I was recommended this hotel.
reviews.title: A Happy New Year

reviews.text: The Lochside hotel, much famed for their exceptional whisky bar, offers also very good accomodation, as well as a lovely restaurant to dine in. The selection of meats, seafood etc. at the restaurant, as well as the hearty breakfasts, certainly deserve a highly positive mention! Our group of 18 were more than satisfied with the whole package this hotel can offer to the Islay visitor. The location of the hotel is also probably the very best on the whole island, as you are smack in the centre of Bowmore, the only town on Islay to have nightlife, many shops, etc.
reviews.title: Location couldn't be better, very kind service & great dining
bad experience
reviews.text: Our group found the staff very courteous and friendly, and helpful - answering all the questions from us tourists. After a day out visiting distilleries and looking at the scenery, there was simply nothing better than coming back, enjoying a pint & dram at the bar, and then having a superb meal in the restaurant, overlooking the bay view. Magnificent is mainly the term that comes to mind.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on to occasions , and found the rooms were in need of some upgrade,the shower head inside the shower was in need of a good clean,as it had black gudge in the holes were the water came out, you could not swing a cat in the toilet, no bath in room, £130.00 PER NIGHT FOR A TWIN ROOM, not worth that, this was the worst hotel i have stayed in for that kind of money,
reviews.title: Friendly, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A five night stay in the Lochside hotel was a mixed experience, overall a positive one. Highlight of the establishment has to be their excellent front of house staff, friendly and helpful at all times, amongst them the charming young lady how served our (excellent) breakfast. . A constant smile and unflappable demeanor - despite some "provocation" from some guests - made her a star.
reviews.title: Sun, sun, sun

reviews.text: Others have rightly praised the bar & I can only add my endorsment.
reviews.title: Basic & comfortable hotel, great whisky bar/restaurant
